llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Great! Based on the information provided in the input file, here's a suggested travel plan for your 3-day trip from St. Louis to Las Vegas, departing on March 29th and returning on March 31st, 2022:

Day 1 (March 29th):

* Departure from St. Louis: You can take a flight from Lambert-St. Louis International Airport (STL) to McCarran International Airport (LAS) in Las Vegas. The flight duration is around 3 hours and 30 minutes, with prices starting from $350.
* Arrival in Las Vegas: You will arrive at McCarran International Airport (LAS) around 12 pm. You can take a taxi or Uber from the airport to your hotel. The distance is around 4 miles, and the journey takes around 15 minutes.
* Hotel check-in: You can check-in at any of the hotels in Las Vegas that fit your budget. Some affordable options include Excalibur Hotel & Casino, Luxor Hotel & Casino, or Circus Circus Hotel & Casino.
* Nighttime activities: You can explore the city's nightlife by visiting some of the famous casinos like Bellagio, Caesars Palace, or MGM Grand. You can also see a show at the Luxor Theatre or the Zumanity theatre.

Day 2 (March 30th):

* Buffet breakfast: Start your day with a buffet breakfast at one of the hotels or casinos in Las Vegas. Some popular options include the Baccarat Buffet at the Bellagio or the Wicked Spoon Buffet at the Cosmopolitan.
* Visit the Hoover Dam: Take a guided tour of the Hoover Dam, which is around 30 miles from Las Vegas. The dam is an engineering marvel and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape.
* Lunch stop: You can grab lunch at one of the restaurants near the Hoover Dam, such as the Hoover Dam Café or the Mike O'Callaghan–Pat Tillman Bridge.
* Return to Las Vegas: After lunch, you can head back to Las Vegas and spend some time exploring the city. You can visit the High Roller observation wheel, take a gondola ride at the Venetian Hotel, or explore the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace.

Day 3 (March 31st):

* Check-out from hotel: Today is your last day in Las Vegas, so make sure to check out of your hotel by noon latest.
* Departure: You can take a flight back to St. Louis from McCarran International Airport (LAS). The flight duration is around 3 hours and 30 minutes, with prices starting from $350.

Budget Breakdown:

* Flight tickets: $1,300 (approximately)
* Hotel stay: $400 (approximately)
* Food and drinks: $600 (approximately)

Total budget for the trip: $2,300 (approximately)

Note: The prices mentioned above are approximate and may vary depending on various factors like seasonality, availability, and your personal preferences. Also, please check with the airlines and hotels for their latest prices and policies.
